intro: Randia nalaensis, commonly known as the Nalaensis randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a glossy surface. Randia nalaensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
